content.description:
The Funeral for a Great Man

Huius viri exsequiaeexsequiae, -arum, f. pl.: funeral magnum ornamentumornamentum, -i, n. = honor, -is Principi, 
magnum saeculo, magnum etiam Foro tulerunt. Et ille 
quidem plenus annis abit, plenus honoribus, illis etiam 
quos recusavitrecuso, -are, -avi: to refuse.
content.question: In line 3, the repetition of the word plenus for emphasis is an example of

unit.text: 3: Pliny's Letters: Ghosts and Apparitions, Letters to Trajan and Calpurnia, and Teacher's Choice - Latin Prose

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
